div1.p: Russell asks that Noguchi examine the tissues he sent, looking especially for Weil's disease.

div1.head: Letter from Joseph H. White to Frederick F. Russell, August 17, 1922
div1.p:
Please ask Noguchi to study the tissues I sent
on S.S. Mexico with a view to possibility of finding Weil's
disease.

The autopsy was a bloody one and entirely free
from macroscopic fat, either in liver, kidneys or any other
organ except heart, and no gross (?) of icterus.

The kidney particularly was highly congested and
hylus very bloody - altogether I suspect we may have Weil's as
well as yellow. I concede the diagnosis of yellow (tenta-
tively at least) but should like the other carefully studied.
